session_log.summary: Implemented real-time SSE streaming progress for pipeline steps, verified UI features (stats badge, layout, scores, auto-collapse, duration timers)
Standard validation of all 78 passing tests (T0 spot + T1 full + T2 full). Zero regressions. Code audit clean — no mocks/stubs/TODOs. All pipeline streaming features verified with real LLM calls.

Completed all remaining T2 tests (42 tests). Enhanced DiffView with line-level diffs, red/green highlights, sync scroll. Added action buttons (Re-forge, Export .md, Edit & Re-forge) to ResultPanel. Fixed clipboard to avoid navigator.clipboard hang. T2 tier complete: 75/75 passing.

Completed all T3 tests (40 tests, #121-160). Built full MCP server with 8 FastMCP tools. Fixed min_score filtering bug. Added DELETE /api/history/all endpoint, frontend clearAllHistory(), sort dropdown, Clear History with confirmation dialog. T3 tier complete: 160/200 passing (80%).

Expanded validation at T3->T4 tier boundary. All 160 tests verified across T0-T3. Zero regressions. Code audit clean. Real LLM pipeline verified (education prompt -> constraint-focused strategy). MCP server 8 tools tested against real DB. Frontend sort/clear/pagination all functional.

Completed all T4 Style & Polish tests (25 tests, #161-185). Enhanced app.css with neon animations, scrollbar styling, skeleton loader. Added pulsing borders, hover effects, left border accents on pipeline steps. Rewrote toast system to use direct DOM manipulation (Svelte 5 cross-component reactivity unreliable for toast pattern). T4 tier complete: 185/200 passing (92.5%).

active_warnings.message: Duplicate data-testid on step-duration-{name} elements (one in expanded view, one in collapsed). Use .first or .nth(0) in Playwright to avoid strict mode violations.
Strengths/weaknesses badges only visible when step isExpanded (running or isLatestActive). They collapse away quickly after step completes and next step starts. Test timing must account for this.

navigator.clipboard.writeText() hangs indefinitely in Puppeteer. Both clipboard.ts and ResultPanel.svelte now use document.execCommand('copy') as primary. Copy feedback verified via queueMicrotask but not visible in Puppeteer screenshots due to timing.

Edit & Re-forge uses nativeInputValueSetter to set textarea value. This works for results from live pipeline runs but may not update Svelte's reactive state when result was loaded from history (loadFromHistory). The textarea visually shows old value. Coding agent verified it worked in session 4 with live pipeline results.

A 'test prompt for SSE verification' record exists in DB with status='running' from T1 SSE format verification (curl --max-time 5 interrupted the pipeline). This is a test artifact, not a bug. Consider cleaning up stale 'running' records.

Svelte 5 event delegation: puppeteer_evaluate dispatched events (click, MouseEvent) do NOT trigger Svelte 5 onclick handlers. Svelte 5 stores handlers as __click on elements and catches events at root via delegation. puppeteer_click may also timeout on buttons with clipboard operations. Workaround: use puppeteer_evaluate to call element.__click() or verify via other means.

Toast system uses direct DOM manipulation instead of Svelte reactivity. Svelte 5 cross-component $state on class instances is unreliable for toast pattern. Also, Svelte DOM reconciliation removes manually-appended children from Svelte-managed containers. Toast elements are appended to document.body to avoid this.

outstanding_mocks.reason: Cosmetic metadata in seed data script, not a stub implementation

next_actions.action: Begin T5 tests (IDs 186-200, Accessibility & Edge Cases). All T0-T4 tests passing (185/200). 15 tests remaining to reach 100%.
Clean up stale 'running' status record in DB from interrupted SSE test (prompt='test prompt for SSE verification'). Either delete it or add a cleanup mechanism for stale running records on startup.

server_state.notes: Both servers healthy. Backend uses uvicorn with --reload flag. Pipeline takes ~28s per optimization. Zero console errors in frontend. Build succeeds. Toast uses direct DOM manipulation on document.body (bypasses Svelte 5 reactivity issues). clipboard copy uses setTimeout(0) to avoid Puppeteer blocking. MCP server has 8 tools. 185/200 tests passing (92.5%). 15 T5 tests remaining.
